fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article said that, according to guidance from the Royal College of Psychiatrists to mental health trusts in England, an investigation is mandatory following the death of a patient recently treated in a psychiatric ward, or who had been under the care of a crisis team or home treatment team when they died. The guidance does not say an investigation is mandatory in these circumstances, but it does say there is an expectation that such deaths will be reviewed (NHS to investigate deaths of all mental health patients, 27 November, page 21). • Other recently corrected articles include: Lady Trumpington, former Bletchley Park codebreaker, dies aged 96 Jamal Khashoggi’s borrowed white privilege made his murder count Sapphic sensation: the rise of the lesbian story on and off screen Sir Aaron Klug obituary The Joy of Waterboiling: kettle cookbook wins oddest book title award
